![](images/javascript.png) ### 1. concat() - `array.concat([value1[, value2[, ...[, valueN]]]])` - . - . ```js let arr1 = [1, 2, 3, 4]; let arr2 = [5, 6]; let arr3 = [7, 8]; console.log(arr1.concat(arr2)); // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]; console.log(arr1.concat(arr2, arr3)); // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]; console.log(arr1); // [1, 2, 3, 4] console.log(arr2); // [5, 6] console.log(arr3); // [7, 8] ```
### 2. push, unshift - - `push()` : - `unshift()` : - : length - . ```js let arr = ['', '', '']; console.log(arr.push('')); // 4 console.log(arr); // ['', '', '', ''] console.log(arr.unshift('')); // 5 console.log(arr); // ['', '', '', '', ''] ```
### 3. pop, shift - - `pop()` : - `shift()` : - : - . ```js let arr = ['', '', '']; console.log(arr.pop()); // console.log(arr); // ['', ''] console.log(arr.shift()); // console.log(arr); // [''] ```
### 4. splice() - `array.splice(start[, deleteCount[, item1[, item2[, ...]]]])` - `start` : - `deleteCount` : - `item1, item2, ...` : ( ) - : - . ```js let arr = ['', '', '', '']; // console.log(arr.splice(2, 1, '')); // [''] console.log(arr); // ['', '', '', ''] // console.log(arr.splice(1, 0, '')); // [] console.log(arr); // ['', '', '', '', ''] // console.log(arr.splice(0, 2)); // ['', ''] console.log(arr); // ['', '', ''] ```
### 5. slice() - `arr.slice([begin[, end]])` - `begin` `end - 1` . - . ```js let arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; console.log(arr.slice(2, 5)); // [3, 4, 5] console.log(arr); // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] ```
### 6. length - ```js let arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; console.log(arr.length); // 5 ```
### 7. fill() - `arr.fill(value[, start[, end]])` - `start` `end - 1` . - `start`, `end` `value` . - . ```js let arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; console.log(arr.fill(0)); // [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]; console.log(arr.fill(1, 1, 3)); // [0, 1, 1, 0, 0]; console.log(arr.fill(5, 2)); // [0, 1, 5, 5, 5]; console.log(arr) // [0, 1, 5, 5, 5]; ```
### 8. includes() - `arr.includes(valueToFind[, fromIndex])` - `fromIndex` : . `0`. ```js let names = ['Jessie', 'Justin', 'Leah']; console.log(names.includes('Jessie')); // true console.log(names.includes('Eddy')); // false console.log(names.includes('Jessie', 1)); // false ```
### 9. join() - `arr.join([separator = ',']);` - separator : ( `,`) - . ```js let arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; console.log(arr.join()); // 1,2,3,4,5 console.log(arr.join('-')); // 1-2-3-4-5 console.log(arr.join('')); // 12345 console.log(arr); // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] ```
### 10. filter() - `arr.filter(callback(element[, index[, array]])[, thisArg])` - `element` : - `index` : - `array` : filter - `thisArg` : callback this - . - . ```js let scores = [30, 40, 60, 75, 90]; let resultScores = []; resultScores = scores.filter((score) => { return score > 70; }); console.log(resultScores); // [75, 90] console.log(scores); // [30, 40, 60, 75, 90] ```
### 11. map() - `arr.map(callback(element[, index[, array]]) [, thisArg])` - `element` : - `index` : - `array` : map - `thisArg` : callback this - map filter . filter map return . - . ```js let arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; let resultArr = []; resultArr = arr.map((item) => { return item ** 2; }); console.log(resultArr); // [1, 4, 9, 16, 25] console.log(arr); // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] ```
### 12. sort() - `arr.sort([compareFunction])` - `compareFunction` : . . - . ```js let arr = [1, 2, 100, 10, 222, 3]; // arr.sort(); console.log(arr); // [1, 10, 100, 2, 222, 3] // arr.sort((a, b) => { return a - b; }); console.log(arr); // [1, 2, 3, 10, 100, 222] // arr.sort((a, b) => { return b - a; }); console.log(arr); // [222, 100, 10, 3, 2, 1] ```
### 13. reverse() - `arr.reverse()` - . ```js let arr = [4, 2, 3, 5, 1]; arr.reverse(); console.log(arr); // [1, 5, 3, 2, 4] ```

![](images/javascript.png) ### 1. concat() - - `str.concat(string2, string3[, ..., stringN])` - . - . ```js let str1 = 'Hello,'; let str2 = 'world!'; console.log(str1.concat(str2)); // Hello,world! console.log(str1); // Hello, console.log(str2); // world! ```
### 2. includes() - `str.includes(searchString[, position])` - `position` : . `0`. ```js let sentence = 'Hello. My name is Jessie'; console.log(sentence.includes('Jessie')); // true console.log(sentence.includes('Hello', 10)); // false ```
### 3. split() - - `str.split([separator[, limit]])` - . - `limit` : limit . - . ```js let str = ' .'; console.log(str.split(' ')); // ["", "", "."] console.log(str.split(' ', 2)); // ["", ""] console.log(str); // " ." ```
### 4. replace() - - `str.replace(regexp|substr, newSubstr|function)` - . - . - [](https://jess2.xyz/JavaScript/variable-regex/) . ```js let str = 'HELLO, My name is Jessie.'; // console.log(str.replace('e', '_')); // HELLO, My nam_ is Jessie. // console.log(str.replace(/e/g, '_')); // HELLO, My nam_ is J_ssi_. // console.log(str.replace(/e/gi, '_')); // H_LLO, My nam_ is J_ssi_. // console.log(str); // HELLO, My name is Jessie. ```
### 5. slice() - - `str.slice(beginIndex[, endIndex])` - `beginIndex` `endIndex - 1` . - `Index` , `strLength`( ) + `Index` - . ```js let str = 'I am Frontend Developer!'; console.log(str.slice(5, 13)); // Frontend console.log(str.slice(5)); // Frontend Developer! console.log(str.slice(5, -3)); // Frontend Develop console.log(str.slice(-5)); // oper! ```
### 6. indexOf() - - `str.indexOf(searchValue[, fromIndex])` - `fromIndex` : - `-1` . ```js let str = 'I love JavaScript and TypeScript'; console.log(str.indexOf('Script')); // 11 console.log(str.indexOf('Script', 20)); // 26 console.log(str.indexOf('Script', 30)); // -1 ```
### 7. match() - - `str.match(regexp)` ```js let str = 'I love JAVASCRIPT and TypeScript'; let pattern = /script/gi; // console.log(str.match(pattern)); // ["SCRIPT", "Script"] ```
### 8. toUpperCase() / toLowerCase() - / - `str.toUpperCase()` - `str.toLowerCase()` - . ```js let str = 'AbCdEfG'; console.log(str.toUpperCase()); // ABCDEFG console.log(str.toLowerCase()); // abcdefg console.log(str); // AbCdEfG ```

### 3. split() - - `str.split([separator[, limit]])` - . - `limit` : limit . - . ```js let str = ' .'; console.log(str.split(' ')); // ["", "", "."] console.log(str.split(' ', 2)); // ["", ""] console.log(str); // " ." ```
### 4. replace() - - `str.replace(regexp|substr, newSubstr|function)` - . - . - [](https://jess2.xyz/JavaScript/variable-regex/) . ```js let str = 'HELLO, My name is Jessie.'; // console.log(str.replace('e', '_')); // HELLO, My nam_ is Jessie. // console.log(str.replace(/e/g, '_')); // HELLO, My nam_ is J_ssi_. // console.log(str.replace(/e/gi, '_')); // H_LLO, My nam_ is J_ssi_. // console.log(str); // HELLO, My name is Jessie. ```
### 5. slice() - - `str.slice(beginIndex[, endIndex])` - `beginIndex` `endIndex - 1` . - `Index` , `strLength`( ) + `Index` - . ```js let str = 'I am Frontend Developer!'; console.log(str.slice(5, 13)); // Frontend console.log(str.slice(5)); // Frontend Developer! console.log(str.slice(5, -3)); // Frontend Develop console.log(str.slice(-5)); // oper! ```
### 6. indexOf() - - `str.indexOf(searchValue[, fromIndex])` - `fromIndex` : - `-1` . ```js let str = 'I love JavaScript and TypeScript'; console.log(str.indexOf('Script')); // 11 console.log(str.indexOf('Script', 20)); // 26 console.log(str.indexOf('Script', 30)); // -1 ```
### 7. match() - - `str.match(regexp)` ```js let str = 'I love JAVASCRIPT and TypeScript'; let pattern = /script/gi; // console.log(str.match(pattern)); // ["SCRIPT", "Script"] ```
### 8. toUpperCase() / toLowerCase() - / - `str.toUpperCase()` - `str.toLowerCase()` - . ```js let str = 'AbCdEfG'; console.log(str.toUpperCase()); // ABCDEFG console.log(str.toLowerCase()); // abcdefg console.log(str); // AbCdEfG ```
